content.description: Two blocks are connected by a rope, as shown above. The masses of the blocks are <math alttext="5 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>5</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the upper block and <math alttext="10 kilograms" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the lower block. An upward applied force of magnitude <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> acts on the upper block.
content.question: If the net acceleration is downward but has a magnitude less than <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, then which has the larger magnitude, the force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> or the tension in the rope?

choices.label: Neither. They have equal but nonzero magnitudes.
Neither. They have equal zero magnitudes.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
